doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 22 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 139[Air Date: 2/26/1985]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 22 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 139[Air Date: 2/26/1985]

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. HTLV testing delay and false positive rate2. Gerry Studds regains chairmanship of the house subcommittee on coastguard and navigationCOMMERCIAL: "Lust in the Dust"3. Kings County Council in Washington state proposes an updated anti-gay discrimination ban for employment 4. More on West Hollywood and domestic partners ordinance5. More on school administrators cancel Tolerance Day in Madison, Maine, because of lesbian speaker6. Commentary on Bernard Goetz, "subway vigilante"COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper7. Los Angeles Mayor Tom Bradley fails to appoint more high level positions to openly gay people and promises to do better if re-elected8. Councilman John Goodner of Houston, Texas plans to challenge current pro-gay mayor, Kathy Whitmire9. Sue Lovell becomes first female president of Houston's Gay Political caucus10. Erie, Pennsylvania Judge questions validity of gay man's will, specifies nearly 120,000 dollar donation to further gay civil rights10. Big Brother accepts any volunteers no matter his/her sexual orientationCOMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store11. Sports, interview with Tom Hull, commissioner of MCAA Big Apple Softball12. Weather report13. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Sara T. Beatrice, Chief of Virology Labs, New York City Department of Health, discusses HTLV 3 test14. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. Media reports/current events/cultureCOMMERCIAL: "Lust in the Dust"2. "Rags of the 80s" Fashion show footage at The LimelightCOMMERCIAL: "Manscape," a gay magazine3. Interview with Dr. Jim Serafini on counseling both straight and gay menCOMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store4. Interview with William Hoffman and Marshall Mason, playwright and director of play "As Is"5. Closing credits
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 22 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 139[Air Date: 2/26/1985]: February 1985
